CHAT.comment: Home Visit 1 took place in living room and play room , CHI sat on Mot's lap , late afternoon
Book Reading 1 , The Very Hungry Caterpillar
Time is 0.25 , side A tape of 7;5.1988
MOT picks up book and points to the cover
part of original tape did not record; first book reading is from second recording

u.a: MOT traces the outline of the leaf with her finger
EXP tells Bro that she'll read him the story later
MOT points out the place where the caterpillar has eaten through the apple
MOT points to the chocolate cake
CHI points to the ice cream cone
MOT points out where his body and mouth are and traces around his wings

CHAT.comment: CHI moves over to sit with her mother.
Time is 7.18 side B , tape of 4;14.1988

u.a: EXP taps on the cover of the book
EXP holds up Cat and Dog
CHI brings cat and dog over to her mother
MOT points to the picture on the cover
CHI points at the title page
CHI refers to the picture of the bicycle
points to the cat on the page
CHI refers to the bird in the picture
CHI points to the cat on the page
CHI refers to both pictures of the cat
CHI points to the picture of the cat
mother turns the page of the book and pauses before answering the question the book poses
CHI gets up and walks into her room to get a book
MOT and EXP discuss the book while CHI goes to her room to get another one

CHAT.comment: Book Reading 3 , The Three Bears Visit Goldilocks
Time is 12.08 , side B tape of 4;14.1988

u.a: CHI returns to the living room and hands her mother a book
opens the book and flips through it
CHI points at one of the stories
CHI is referring to the story where the three bears are eating from the dishes
points at each of the bears
points at each of the bears
MOT opens the book to the title page and points to Goldilocks
verifier is guessing that this is not part of the text because Mot raises her voice slightly then resumes lower tone for next sentence she reads
sibilant noises to appoximate the toothpaste squeezing out
MOT makes a face for CHI by closing one of her eyes up tightly
CHI tries to turn the page before her Mother finishes reading the one she is on
sounds as if CHI is trying to recite text along with Mot
